title: Bob Sloman
text:
Robert Sloman (c. 1898 – December 1970) was an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s. He played club level rugby union (RU) or <a href="Plymouth%20Albion%20R.F.C.">Plymouth Albion</a>, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Oldham%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage No. 210</a>) (<a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>), as a , i.e. number 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Bob Sloman was born in <a href="Plymouth">Plymouth</a>, <a href="Devon">Devon</a>, England, and he died aged 72 in
<a href="Plymouth">Plymouth</a>, <a href="Devon">Devon</a>, England
Playing career.
International honours.
Bob Sloman won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Oldham in 1923 against Wales, in 1924 against <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a>, in 1925 against Wales, in 1926 against Wales, in 1928 against Wales, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Oldham in 1928 against Australia (3 matches), and New Zealand (2 matches).
Bob Sloman was selected for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Oldham for the <a href="1924%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">1924 Great Britain Lions tour of Australia and New Zealand</a>, he did not play in any of the <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20league%29">Test match</a>es on this tour.
Championship Final appearances.
Bob Sloman played right-, i.e. number 12, in <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a>'s 2–13 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship%20First%20Division">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1921%E2%80%9322%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Championship%20Play-Off">1921–22 season</a> at <a href="The%20Cliff%20%28training%20ground%29">The Cliff</a>, <a href="Broughton%2C%20Greater%20Manchester">Broughton</a> on Saturday 6 May 1922, in front of a crowd of 26,700.
County League appearances.
Bob Sloman played in <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a>'s victory in the <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20League">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20leagues">County League</a> during the <a href="1921%E2%80%9322%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1921–22 season</a>.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Bob Sloman played left-, i.e. number 11, in <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a>'s 4–21 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1923%E2%80%9324%20Challenge%20Cup">1923–24</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1923%E2%80%9324%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1923–24 season</a> at <a href="Athletic%20Grounds%2C%20Rochdale">Athletic Grounds, Rochdale</a> on Saturday 12 April 1924, in front of a crowd of 12,000. played left-, i.e. number 11, in the 16–3 victory over <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="1924%E2%80%9325%20Challenge%20Cup">1924–25</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1924%E2%80%9325%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1924–25 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, in front of a crowd of 41,831, played right-, i.e. number 12, in the 3–9 defeat by <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a> in the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Challenge%20Cup">1925–26</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1925–26 season</a> at <a href="Athletic%20Grounds%2C%20Rochdale">Athletic Grounds, Rochdale</a>, in front of a crowd of 28,500, and played left-, i.e. number 11, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in the 26–7 victory over <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a> in the <a href="1926%E2%80%9327%20Challenge%20Cup">1926–27</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1926%E2%80%9327%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1926–27 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a>, in front of a crowd of 27,800. 
County Cup Final appearances.
Bob Sloman played left-, i.e. number 11, in <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a>'s 10–0 victory over <a href="St%20Helens%20Recreation%20RLFC">St Helens Recs</a> in the <a href="1924%20Lancashire%20Cup">1924</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1924%E2%80%9325%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1924–25 season</a> at <a href="The%20Willows%2C%20Salford">The Willows, Salford</a> on Saturday 22 November 1924, in front of a crowd of 15,000.
Club career.
Bob Sloman changed <a href="rugby%20football">rugby football</a> codes from <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> to <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> when he transferred from <a href="Plymouth%20Albion%20R.F.C.">Plymouth Albion R.F.C.</a> to <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> during August 1921.
